title: Study: Half of Moabites can’t afford housing
description: This story explained findings from multiple studies recently completed by state and local governments about Moab’s housing crisis, which by many measures, is the worst in Utah.

title: Seasonal workers are running out on unemployment insurance
description: Due to a lack of local job opportunities, Moab workers typically rely on unemployment insurance when it isn’t tourism season. This year, the pandemic struck as their benefits ran out. Congress took action, but a month hence, the state had yet to help them and had no timeline for assistance.

title: Mail thief caught?
description: This story broke news about the Inspector General of the U.S. Postal Service finding a "person of interest" during an investigation of multiple recent cases of alleged mail theft at the Moab Post Office. Months prior, the newspaper published reports about [locals alleging such theft](https://moabtimes.com/2019/04/26/locals-tell-their-missing-mail-stories/). The person of interest [later pled guilty to the charges against him](https://moabtimes.com/2020/03/06/former-moab-post-office-employee-pleads-guilty-to-mail-theft/).

title: Does Sand Flats even have any oil?
description: After the Bureau of Land Management proposed two parcels inside a local recreation area [go up for oil and gas lease sales](https://moabtimes.com/2020/01/31/city-opposes-subsurface-drilling-in-sand-flats/), the newspaper found that the last company to look for oil there had come up dry.

title: School business administrator resigns amid investigation
description: Amid an investigation into allegations of sexual harassment by a longtime district employee, the local school district placed the former business administrator on leave. He later signed an agreement to resign his position.

title: Auditor: Kiva Montessori might not last 12 months
description: This story explained poor financial findings by an independent auditor about a public Montessori school in Cortez. The school, at the time, was facing [financial](https://the-journal.com/articles/118934-kivas-use-of-emergency-fund-might-be-unconstitutional), [leadership](https://the-journal.com/articles/115305-before-changes-kiva-parents-criticized-school-leadership-for-over-a-year), and [student performance](https://the-journal.com/articles/114863-staff-shakeup-low-test-scores-hit-kiva-montessori-school) problems, among [others](https://the-journal.com/articles/117894-ckms-board-no-evidence-of-asbestos-exposure)

title: Moab loses ‘Padre Espiritual’ in car crash; suspect faces manslaughter charge
description: A deadly crash at the center of town in February took the life of a local spiritual leader. His son later died from injuries sustained in the crash.

on October 16, 2017
description: In the first episode of The Praeci Podcast, I spoke to Robin Kelley, NC State’s deputy Title IX coordinator, about the history of Title IX, including contemporaneous changes made by Betsy DeVos.

title: Protected Class: Moses T. Alexander Greene
publish-info:
Published via The Praeci Podcast
on February 7, 2018
description: I spoke with the director of the African American Cultural Center at NC State about common mistakes White people make when talking about Black people and identity. This podcast episode is [nominated for a national collegiate award](https://www.linkedin.com/feed/update/urn:li:activity:6435915679433580544).

title: Tales of trails: My very bad, no good night on Porcupine Rim
description: Porcupine Rim, a popular downhill mountain biking route in Moab, is notorious for the dangers it poses to riders. My first encounter with the trail ended with a flat tire and a long walk in the dark.

title: Beloved black buck leaves legacy
description: Albino deer are rare. Even more rare are melanistic deer, which have a darker-than-typical pigment. Moab had just such a deer, but in late 2019, it died sooner than some locals were prepared to bid it farewell.
